ca.uqac.lif.textidote.as

Class Range

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.textidote.as.Range
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Range>

    public class Range
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Range>

    Represents a contiguous interval of characters in a text file. A range is defined by a “start” and an “end” position.

      • isWithin

        public boolean isWithin(Position p)

        Checks if a position is within the current range.

        Parameters:
        p - The position
        Returns:
        true if the position is in the range, false if it lies outside the range

        public Range intersectWith(Range r)

        Intersects the current range with the one given as argument

        Parameters:
        r - The range to intersect with
        Returns:
        The range corresponding to the intersection, or null if the two ranges do not overlap

      • setZero

        public Range setZero(Position zero)

        Offsets the start/end position of the range by using the given position as (0,0)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This range
